---
title: "s3_provided.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines a configuration for storage using Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service). It specifies the storage type as "object" and further defines the object storage type as "S3" with a specific bucket name.

## Symbols

### `storage`
#### Description
The root configuration block that defines the storage settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets the storage type to "object"
- Contains nested configuration for object storage

### `storage.type`
#### Description
Specifies the type of storage to be used.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | The type of storage, set to "object" |

### `storage.object`
#### Description
Configuration block for object storage settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Defines the specific type of object storage
- Contains nested configuration for S3

### `storage.object.type`
#### Description
Specifies the type of object storage.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | The type of object storage, set to "s3" |

### `storage.object.s3`
#### Description
Configuration block for Amazon S3 specific settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Defines the S3 bucket to be used

### `storage.object.s3.bucket`
#### Description
Specifies the name of the S3 bucket to be used for storage.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| bucket | string | The name of the S3 bucket, set to "testbucket" |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| storage.type | string | "object" | Specifies the storage type as object storage |
| storage.object.type | string | "s3" | Specifies the object storage type as Amazon S3 |
| storage.object.s3.bucket | string | "testbucket" | Specifies the name of the S3 bucket to be used |

This YAML configuration file is likely used as test data for a system that interacts with different storage backends, particularly Amazon S3. The file provides a simple, clear example of how to configure S3 storage with a specified bucket name. This could be used in unit tests or integration tests to verify that the system correctly reads and interprets S3 storage configurations.
